So, my friend and I came into the store first.  No greeting.  I mean, whatever, nothing too big to complain about.  We were browsing the flavours when two other girls came into the store.  The employee then talked to them and they seemed to be friends.  After two minutes, we were ready to order and the employee was still talking to the two girls for around 5-10 minutes.  She also served them first! (Ha!)  It wasn't until her friend stopped (annoyed) and pointed at us, whispering, apparently signalling for her friend (the employee) to go and serve us.  The employee also looked annoyed that she had to stop her conversation 'cus we wanted to order something... so anyway, we asked her if she had the Cookies & Cream flavour and she just replied, "No."  That's it!  and then she went back to her friends.  She didn't even say, "Sorry" "Do you want anything else" and she didn't even ask my friend who was actually ready to order her Pistachio ice cream.  She just said one word and went back to talk to her friends.  

It was like we weren't even there!  I find it so rude to be treated as if you don't even exist.  It's so much worse than being given attitude...at least the person acknowledges your presence.  I will NEVER go to this location again.  I love Baskin Robbins but I'd rather just walk to the Eaton Centre location than go to this place again!  I hope no one ever has to experience being ignored like that.

A cute place to lounge and relax in with your friends.  It's comfortable and neat.  I've been here two to three times now and I've always sat on the couches with the big coffee tables.  

+ Oh and I asked for water once and they pointed me to the little water cooler table near the door.  I didn't really mind getting up to pour myself water but just something I wanted to point out.

It's a bit pricy but this is the only reason I come back here:

The chocolate waffles are heavenly.

Also, the heart post-it message board is really cute.  I remember writing messages with my friends on there back when I was in high school.

Computer Doctor BG did a thorough diagnosis of my computer until they resolved the problem which allowed me to keep my business  up and running. The marvelous thing about what they did is I have a older Mac computer and they found parts that would enable it to keep performing.
Awesome food and great music. A must eat with authentic Mexican food. Not the Tex Mex fast food crap!!! The homemade wine is divine! The home chocolate ice cream is fabulous and so yummy!!

We went to Cafe Sam to celebrate 2 birthdays. Service was slow. Downstairs was not to busy. Four out of seven meals were unedible. Steaks we found out were from last week for Valentines Day. The steaks were tough needless to say. No bread. I had to ask for our salads. Manger Dan really was passive in talking to us. He did give us alcoholic drinks which was nice but I don't drink alcohol. The only thing that was great was conversation with friends.

Dropped the car of for an oil change, tire rotation (which they do for free since I bought the tires there), check of the transmission fluids, and power steering. I left with an oil change. 1 out of the 4 things I asked for was completed.  The reason I know nothing got done was it was not on my receipt for checking the fluids and I mark my tires to make sure they do a tire rotation.  I got home and my same mark was on my drivers side front tire.  Called them back and they said since my tires were worn that they can't rotate them...um b.s. They flat out did not do it.  This was after they would not prorate me for new tires that I bought from them and got 35,000 miles on 65,000 mile tires. They said I needed to have tire rotation records (which I do have just not from Brian's).  How do you get tire rotation records when you don't rotate the tires?  When I called Bridgestone about my tire warranty they said to not go there (Brian's) and go to another place   Shady place..be careful.

I had a fine experience opening my account. Life changes necessitated me rolling these funds to another custodian after 2 years. A full 6 weeks after the new custodian, a major corporation, sent ALL the proper paperwork to ETC, ETC decided one of the forms was "too light" and needed to be resubmitted by the new custodian. Then they said that they would need "at least" three more weeks to "review" the replaced form before they would transfer my funds. I am about ready to book a flight to Ohio so I can scream at them in person. They talk around and around in circles, pathetic excuse for a company.

This place has great service! The mechanic is extremely knowledgable and honest. He does good work and charges a fair price. 

My car wouldn't start one day but when the tow truck got to me it started. I thought my starter was going out, but I took my car here and he knew right away that it needed a battery. He put in a new one to check it and make sure that was the problem. He said I could take it somewhere else but he dialed O'Reilly's and had me ask them what they charge to prove he was giving me a good deal. This is definitely a good place to bring a vehicle for repairs.

Four friends and myself ate at Alloy for my Birthday dinner last night and I must say I was not overly impressed. 
The decor is unique and the atmosphere was cool but that just does not make up for average food at an above average price. If it were not for the food I think I would give this place a 4! But in the end that is what tells the real story for me. 
We all tried a different starter, main and we shared a few salads so I can certainly say I gave it a fair chance. 
Service was friendly but did not seem overly knowledgeable, no food descriptions or desire created,
Dish presentation was quite nice, 
Food was sub par, I kept expecting to be wowed by one of the 12 + dishes we ordered but in the end the candle burnt out and we were left with a hefty bill and disappointed taste buds. 
I may go back when the patio is open on a nice day to give it one more shot but that will be long after I try several other places on the bookmark list including some repeats to places like The Muse and Rouge where I would gladly spend my time and money :)

Mmm Mmm Mmm!! 

Great location, atmosphere, knowledgeable staff and in the end every little morsel of food was gobbled up and plates licked clean haha. 
The 3 people who joined me had the same reaction and we all said we would go back any time! 

Thank you for an intimate, delightful dining experience!

This salon is sub-par. If you make an appointment you will quickly learn that actually doing hair is not the priority here. The stylists are watching TV/bootleg movies, texting, and taking cell phone calls while doing the client's hair. As a client, I felt like I was distracting my stylist from watching her movie rather than being the focus of her attention. Also, expect to be double booked for a hair appointment time slot and don't be surprised if the stylist leaves you under the dryer for 40 minutes to run down the street to the store. I have always had natural hair and I am used to the way black salons normally run and this is below average. 

I might be able to deal with the unprofessionalism if my hair was done well, but this isn't the case. The stylist burned my hair because she was trying to do everything but pay attention to her job. On a positive note-the staff there is nice and polite, but I still won't be going back.

i have been a customer for a long time and the staff has always been friendly, knowledgable, and available when you need to find something.  i trade in my clothes and the process is quick and easy.  the two men (Josh and Dave) are always friendly and willing to help you.  they work very hard and keep things organized.  i think it's the best that i have seen in all the years that i have been there.
i like that they have all sorts of other things to buy.  it's not just clothes but a lot of household goods to update your decor.  it's just a fun place to spend a few hours either buying or looking!

YUMMY! Had dinner here our first night, then breakfast the next morning, and breakfast again the next morning. The wait staff is awesome! The GM indicated they had a re-do about 3 months back and everything is made from scratch, even the jams. Back to the original recipes. 

Great food at a great value! 
ENJOY!

The Stromboli was good. Service was very pleasant. The place was dark and old, having to walk through the smoke filled bar to get to the glass partitioned dining room was disappointing....hold your breathe!  Would I go back, probably not. Once and done.

LOVE THIS PLACE! I was in Vegas 4 nights and ate here 2 of them. It was recommended by a local and is the most amazing Japanese restaurant on this side of the Pacific! 

Blue Fin Tuna Sushimi, Yellow Tail Tar Tar, Black Cod, Ramen

I moved to Shaker about a year ago, with the loyalty to the barbershop I've been visiting, I have never tried any local barbershop. I have been driving back and forth 2 hours to go back to Tiffin to visit, then trying to catch the barber's free time between the appointments. 

Long story short. I have to get a hair cut by today, can't wait due to scheduling issue. Found this one near by, decided to give it a try. 

Sgro's doesn't go by appointments. I walked in around 5:05, the shop closes at 5:30. They took their time to meet my specific request for my hair style. By the time was done, it was already pass the closing time. The outcome is clean and neat. 

They really know their stuff. 

Now, one more place to go for my haircut, and will go back again.
